channel.title: [Allstar 317] Need help with outstream
channel.description:
if (!nonWild()) { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(3); // outStream.writeByteA(1); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu outStream.writeString("@dre@Attack"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); } else if (nonWild()) { }
This is the code, what I want it to do is to show a dark red colored "attack" in the drop down menu when you right click a player in the wilderness but hides in a safe zone. This is what it's doing, attack shows up no matter what the nonwild status is. I've tried multiple ways of doing it and if I change it to "if (nonWild)" without the exclamation, it shows up no where.

item.title: [Allstar 317] Need help with outstream
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Fox Lord Fox
item.description:
@Lord_Fox wrote:

Tested, didn’t work.
I believe this is something I also tried.

EDIT: This is the only error my server has had and I’m not sure how to fix Dx I hope someone can help me!

Read full topic

item.title: [Allstar 317] Need help with outstream
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

            if (!nonWild()) {
            outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
            outStream.writeByteC(3); // 
            outStream.writeByteA(1); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
            outStream.writeString("@dre@Attack");
            outStream.endFrameVarSize();
            } else if (nonWild()) {
            outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
            outStream.writeByteC(3); // 
            outStream.writeByteA(1); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
            outStream.writeString(" ");
            outStream.endFrameVarSize();
            }

Read full topic

item.title: [Allstar 317] Need help with outstream
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Fox Lord Fox
item.description:
@Lord_Fox wrote:

if (!nonWild()) { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(3); // outStream.writeByteA(1); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu outStream.writeString("@dre@Attack"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); } else if (nonWild()) { }

This is the code, what I want it to do is to show a dark red colored “attack” in the drop down menu when you right click a player in the wilderness but hides in a safe zone.

This is what it’s doing, attack shows up no matter what the nonwild status is. I’ve tried multiple ways of doing it and if I change it to “if (nonWild)” without the exclamation, it shows up no where.
